name: biomni-analyze-cytokine-production-in-cd4-tcells
title: Biomni: Analyze Cytokine Production In Cd4 Tcells
description: Analyze cytokine production in CD4+ T cells after antigen stimulation using intracellular flow cytometry
content:
Overview

Analyze cytokine production profiles in CD4+ T cells following antigen stimulation using intracellular flow cytometry data. This tool processes FCS files to quantify the frequency and intensity of cytokine-producing cells, enabling comprehensive characterization of T helper (Th) cell subsets including Th1 (IFN-γ), Th2 (IL-4, IL-5, IL-13), Th17 (IL-17A, IL-22), and Treg (IL-10, TGF-β) populations based on their cytokine signatures.

Input Parameters

  • fcs_files_dict (dict, required): Dictionary mapping sample identifiers to FCS file paths. Keys are sample names (e.g., 'unstimulated', 'PMA_ionomycin', 'antigen_specific'), and values are paths to corresponding FCS files containing intracellular cytokine staining data

Input Format

{
  "fcs_files_dict": {
    "unstimulated": "/path/to/control.fcs",
    "anti_CD3_CD28": "/path/to/stimulated.fcs",
    "PMA_ionomycin": "/path/to/positive_control.fcs"
  }
}

Biological Use Case

Critical for characterizing T cell responses in infection, autoimmunity, and immunotherapy. Applications include: (1) Profiling Th1/Th2 balance in allergic disease models, (2) Quantifying polyfunctional T cell responses (cells producing multiple cytokines simultaneously) in vaccine studies, (3) Assessing pathogenic Th17 cell frequencies in autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis or inflammatory bowel disease, (4) Evaluating regulatory T cell suppressive function through IL-10 production, (5) Monitoring antigen-specific CD4+ T cell responses in infectious disease models, and (6) Characterizing cytokine profiles in tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes for cancer immunology research.

Output

Provides detailed cytokine analysis including: percentage of cytokine-positive cells for each marker, mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) values, frequency of polyfunctional cells producing multiple cytokines, comparison statistics across conditions, and Th subset identification. Results include summary statistics and visualizations saved to 'cytokine_results.txt'.

Category

immunology
